sources_scanned: Korean Tech Media (PwC Korea, Seoul Economic Daily)

signals.title: Hyperscale AI Data Centers: 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2026
signals.summary: Hyperscale AI data centers are now consuming over 1 gigawatt of electricity each, bundling hundreds of thousands of GPUs like Nvidia's H100s. Over 50% powered by fossil fuels, raising energy costs and infrastructure concerns for communities. Major tech firms investing hundreds of billions.

signals.title: D-Wave Announces First Major Quantum Computing Breakthrough of 2026
signals.summary: D-Wave claimed quantum supremacy after successfully simulating magnetic materials properties using Advantage2 annealing quantum computer. IBM predicts 2026 will mark first time quantum outperforms classical computers on practical problems.

signals.title: AI-Quantum Convergence: 2026 Inflection Point
signals.summary: 2026 emerging as inflection point where AI and quantum computing function as unified force. Google DeepMind's AlphaQubit AI Decoder identifies qubit errors with 30% greater accuracy than traditional methods. Neural networks now predict and correct qubit errors in real-time.

signals.title: Error-Correction Technology Brings Quantum Computing Closer to Reality
signals.summary: Advances in quantum error-correction bring dream of large-scale quantum computation involving millions of qubits within reach. Marks critical milestone for practical quantum applications.

signals.title: Science's 2025 Breakthrough of the Year: Unstoppable Rise of Renewable Energy
signals.summary: For first time, wind and solar supplied more power than coal worldwide. Global solar and wind installations exceeded 800 GW last year—tripling yearly deployments since 2021. Annual storage installations expected to exceed 100 GW in 2026.

signals.title: Climate Status 2026: Record Temperatures Despite La Niña
signals.summary: 2025 was second-hottest year on record. Last 12 years warmest ever measured. Last 3 years exceeded 1.4°C above preindustrial. Oceans absorbed energy equivalent to detonating nearly 10 Hiroshima bombs per second every minute in 2025. US emissions rose 2% in 2025 reversing downward trend.

signals.title: China's Clean Energy Dominance: 300 GW Annual Installations
signals.summary: China's emissions stabilized over past 18 months. EVs comprise >50% of new car sales. China installed >300 GW renewable capacity annually—exceeding entire US historical total. Exported >$200B clean technologies globally. Emerged as dominant clean energy innovator.

signals.title: WHO Pandemic Agreement to be Finalized in 2026
signals.summary: First Pandemic Agreement adopted at 78th World Health Assembly in May 2025. Annex on Pandemic Access and Benefits-Sharing set for consideration at 79th WHA in May 2026. Establishes fair, rapid, globally-agreed system for vaccine and medical innovation access.

signals.title: UN Declaration on NCDs and Mental Health Adopted
signals.summary: 80th UN General Assembly adopted political declaration to combat NCDs and mental health challenges through fully integrated approach. Fourth high-level meeting on NCDs held September 25, 2025.

signals.title: IMF Projects Global Growth Slowdown to 3.1% by 2026
signals.summary: Global growth projected to slow from 3.3% (2024) to 3.2% (2025) to 3.1% (2026). Emerging markets expected to grow just above 4%. Improvements in monetary and fiscal policy frameworks reduced reliance on foreign exchange interventions.

signals.title: World Bank Warns of Insufficient Income Gap Closing
signals.summary: Growth expected to weaken to 2.3% in 2025—significant downgrade. Only tepid recovery expected in 2026-27. Progress by emerging economies in closing per capita income gaps with advanced economies remains insufficient. Poverty reduction anticipated to be inadequate.

signals.title: Social Exit Movement: Abandoning Constant Digital Exposure
signals.summary: 2026 marks year of 'social exit'—gradual abandonment of sociality based on constant exposure, identity performance, compulsive consumption. Time spent on digital platforms declining. People moving to analog hobbies (scrapbooking, crochet), CD players instead of apps, cinema trips instead of streaming.

signals.title: Exclusive Digital Networks Replace Open Algorithms
signals.summary: In 2026, digital discovery moves behind velvet ropes. Search won't feel broken but gated, shaped by insider networks and trusted recommendations rather than open algorithms. Exclusivity signals taste in age of information abundance.

signals.title: Hyper-Personalization and Identity-Driven Consumption Rise
signals.summary: People placing greater emphasis on what feels right personally rather than societal expectations. Keywords include 'individuality,' 'identity,' 'choice,' 'self-determination.' Life decisions increasingly defined around personal values. Wellness mentions rose 16% from 2024.

signals.title: Spirituality Over Partying: Inner Peace as New Social Currency
signals.summary: People choosing spirituality over partying in 2026 for mental peace, emotional balance, deeper meaning. Rising stress, anxiety, burnout make mindful practices more appealing than alcohol-driven nightlife. Inner peace becoming new flex—being grounded, mindful, spiritually aligned seen as attractive in romantic and professional spaces.

signals.title: Emotional Fitness and Nervous System Regulation Mainstream
signals.summary: Emotional wellness becoming proactive and preventive like physical fitness. Emotional fitness practices—micro-therapy sessions, mood-mapping, cognitive resilience training—part of daily routines. Wellness studios rolling out 'emotional gyms' with guided somatic sessions, breathwork circuits, group nervous-system training. Vagus nerve regulation—breathwork, cold plunges, sound baths—filling gyms and corporate wellness programs.

signals.title: DeepSeek mHC: Architecture Breakthrough for Trillion-Parameter Models
signals.summary: DeepSeek released paper solving training instability at scale by constraining information mixing to doubly stochastic matrices, enabling stable training of much larger models. Sebastian Raschka called mHC 'striking breakthrough that could shape evolution of foundational models.' Could unlock trillion-parameter AI models.

signals.title: Recursive Language Models: The 2026 AI Paradigm
signals.summary: RLM allows LLM to manage its own context through persistent Python REPL, calling sub-LLMs programmatically rather than loading everything into context. Directly addresses context rot—performance degradation as context grows. Maintains performance across 1.5M characters while standard LLMs fail. Enables learning through reinforcement learning with RLM scaffolding.

signals.title: Venture Capital to Increase 10% to High $400B in 2026
signals.summary: Global VC deployment expected to increase from low $400B to high $400B, implying 10% increase. After two years of capital scarcity, liquidity returning to venture ecosystem. Investors will navigate more selective, quality-driven environment where access, underwriting discipline, cross-market insights matter most.

signals.title: AI Captures 65% of US VC Deal Value in 2026
signals.summary: AI driving VC momentum, capturing 65% of US VC deal value and 37.1% of non-life-sciences first financings. AI startups commanding significantly higher valuations and round sizes across all stages. US accounts for 85% of global AI funding and 53% of AI deals. AI startups raise capital earlier and faster—median age at first financing 65% lower than non-AI peers.

signals.title: 2026 Fundamentals-First Year: Revenue Growth Over AI Veneer
signals.summary: 2026 is fundamentals-first year where capital rewards revenue growth, efficiency, real AI advantage. Punishes AI veneer on old ideas. Investors prioritizing strong unit economics, growth, defensible market positions. Climate tech losing share (requires long-term patient capital), crypto wait-and-see (price decreases), vertical SaaS without AI differentiation hard to justify.

signals.title: IPO Market Forecasts 68 Offerings in 2026 (44.7% Increase)
signals.summary: Base case forecasts 68 IPOs in 2026, matching decade average excluding 2021 and 44.7% higher than projected 2025 count. IPOs concentrated in AI, crypto, fintech, defense, space. Secondaries increasingly becoming core liquidity tool. Secondary pricing likely to tighten, favoring early movers and primary investors.

signals.title: State Interventionism and Trade Policy Acceleration in 2026
signals.summary: Governments enacting new trade policies—tariffs, export controls, local content requirements—to mandate or incentivize companies to modify supply chains and trade patterns. State interventionism flourishing with governments increasingly intervening through subsidies, ownership stakes, local content mandates. Traditional economic logic less decisive while geopolitics gains prominence.

signals.title: AI Regulation: EU AI Act Becomes Fully Applicable August 2, 2026
signals.summary: Governments increasingly treating AI assets as national security priority and critical infrastructure. AI serving as force multiplier of cyber conflicts. EU AI Act moving from planning to real operational gravity as it becomes fully applicable August 2, 2026. Other jurisdictions regulating AI and data with different priorities, creating regulatory complexity.

signals.title: New START Expires February 2026: End of Nuclear Arms Control
signals.summary: New START treaty expires February 2026, leaving US and Russia without legally binding nuclear restrictions. Without verification mechanisms, deployed warheads could potentially exceed 6,000 within a decade, increasing nuclear risks globally. Marks end of arms control era.

signals.title: China as 'Electrostate': 50%+ EV Sales, Renewable Dominance
signals.summary: China surpasses Western nations in electricity's share of energy consumption through rapid EV adoption (50%+ of vehicles sold in 2025) and renewable grid expansion. Now dominates solar, battery, EV exports to developing nations. Emergence of 'electrostate' concept.

signals.title: US Foreign Aid Cuts: $63.3B to $28.5B (55% Reduction)
signals.summary: US foreign aid dropped from $63.3B (2024) to $28.5B (2026 estimates). Women in conflict zones face disproportionate harm—cuts eliminating 90% of maternal/reproductive health assistance, potentially causing 34,000 pregnancy-related deaths annually.

signals.title: Korea's AI Semiconductor R&D Budget Jumps 24.3% to 1.68T Won
signals.summary: Ministry of Science and ICT confirmed 2026 R&D comprehensive implementation plan with 1.68 trillion won allocated to ICT sector, representing 24.3% increase (328 billion won) vs 2025. Investment in AI semiconductors and quantum computing being strengthened. Government pursuing self-reliance in AI computing based on domestic NPUs.
key_entities: Korea Ministry of Science and ICT

signals.title: Korea's First Commercial Quantum-AI Hybrid Data Center Launching
signals.summary: QAI plans to launch Korea's first commercial hybrid data center service as early as next month with 20-qubit quantum computer, collaborating with domestic quantum computer company SDT and data center operator DCP. QAI envisions quadruple hybrid data center integrating CPU, GPU, NPU, QPU.

signals.title: Korea AI Semiconductor Leap Strategy: 5 Unicorns by 2030
signals.summary: Korean government approved 'AI Semiconductor Industry Leap Strategy,' aiming to nurture 5 global AI semiconductor unicorn companies and 5 technology-leading SMEs by 2030. Memory demand centered on AI-purpose HBM, DDR5, SSD expected to exceed supply through 2026 per Samsung and SK Hynix forecasts.

signals.title: CES 2026: Agentic AI and Physical AI Era Begins
signals.summary: CES 2026 concluded with 148,000+ attendees. Highlighted 'agentic AI' that can judge and act autonomously beyond generative AI, and 'physical AI' serving as brain for robots and machines. Record 470 companies in Korea Pavilion, approximately 1,000 Korean companies total exhibiting.

signals.title: FDA Approves First TA-TMA Treatment (Omeros Yartemlea)
signals.summary: FDA approved Omeros' Yartemlea as first treatment for hematopoietic stem cell transplant-associated thrombotic microangiopathy (TA-TMA). US launch planned for January 2026. Addresses previously untreatable rare disease.

signals.title: Kyverna CAR-T Shows Breakthrough Results for Stiff Person Syndrome
signals.summary: Kyverna announced top-line data showing CAR T-cell therapy miv-cel achieved highly statistically significant and sustained improvements in overall disability, mobility, stiffness in patients with stiff person syndrome (SPS). Plans to file BLA for SPS in first half of 2026.

signals.title: Biotech M&A Expected to Surge in 2026 Amid Patent Cliff
signals.summary: Big Pharma racing to acquire biotech assets as $170 billion patent cliff looms. PitchBook analysts see '2026 as providing one of best investing opportunities we have seen in decades.' Abivax shares surged 31% on takeover speculation. Deals expected to accelerate in 2026.

signals.title: US Space Force Bets on On-Orbit Satellite Servicing: 4 Missions in 2026
signals.summary: Space Force betting private sector can provide satellite servicing capabilities. Four missions scheduled for 2026 to demonstrate on-orbit refueling, servicing, repair capabilities to extend lives of military satellites. Marks shift to commercial space services for defense.

signals.title: China Integrates Commercial Space into National Development Plan
signals.summary: China expected to announce Five-Year Plan for 2026-2030 during political sessions in March. China's space administration published policy blueprint aimed at accelerating commercial space development, stating they will 'incorporate commercial spaceflight into overall national space development plan.'

signals.title: Vast Plans First Commercial Space Station Launch (Haven-1) in 2026
signals.summary: American company Vast plans to launch first ever commercial space station (Haven-1) in 2026. Marks beginning of commercial orbital infrastructure era. Direct-to-device market will drive further adjustments in business plans for commercial satellite communications.

signals.title: Space Regulatory Deadline: Part 450 Compliance by March 10, 2026
signals.summary: Looming deadline of March 10, 2026 for Part 450 compliance for all licensees may not provide enough time for all operators to transition existing licenses. Creates regulatory pressure on space industry.

signals.title: US Policy Reforms to Expedite Space Mission Authorizations
signals.summary: Current US administration taking far-reaching actions to ensure new space-based industries, exploration capabilities, cutting-edge defense systems pioneered in America. Secretary of Commerce proposing process for mission authorizations to expedite approvals and enable American space competitiveness.

signals.title: 14 Climate Trends for 2026: EVs to Nuclear Power
signals.summary: Bloomberg identifies 14 major climate trends to track in 2026 spanning EV adoption, nuclear power resurgence, renewable energy expansion, climate policy shifts. Signals major year for energy transition despite political headwinds.

signals.title: Gene Editing Clinical Trials for Rare Disorders Expected in 2026
signals.summary: Clinical trials of gene editing to treat rare human disorders expected in 2026. Scientists developed new gene-editing tool STITCHR that can insert edits up to 12.7 kilobases long without errors. Marks expansion of gene therapy to broader disorder spectrum.

signals.title: COVID mRNA Vaccines May Enhance Cancer Immunotherapy
signals.summary: mRNA-based COVID vaccines may make cancer therapies work better. Vaccinated people with lung or skin cancer who were treated with immunotherapy tended to live longer than their unvaccinated counterparts. Suggests unexpected synergy between vaccination and cancer treatment.
